intro: Monsonia nivea var. intermedia, commonly known as the white monsonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a low-growing habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
